intro: Thapsia polygama, commonly known as the broad-leaved thapsia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are broad and lobed, often with a distinctive silvery or grayish underside. Thapsia polygama is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
